item.title: More Than 200 Are Killed in Turkish Mining Disaster
item.description: Rescuers battled on Wednesday to reach coal miners trapped underground after one of the biggest mining disasters in Turkey in decades.
item.dc:creator: By SEBNEM ARSU and ALAN COWELL
item.media:description: A rescue worker carried out an injured miner after an explosion in a coal mine in Manisa, Turkey.

item.title: Foreign Factories in Vietnam Weigh Damage in Anti-China Riots
item.description: The rampage was in protest of China’s placing an oil rig in disputed waters, but most of the factories hit were owned by companies from South Korea and Taiwan.
item.dc:creator: By CHAU DOAN and THOMAS FULLER

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Taiwan Concerned Over Mistaken Identity in Vietnam Protests
item.description: Taiwan’s Foreign Ministry has condemned protests in Vietnam that targeted businesses based in Taiwan, in an apparent case of mistaken identity by demonstrators angered by mainland China’s placement of an offshore drilling platform in waters claimed by Vietnam.
item.dc:creator: By AUSTIN RAMZY
item.media:credit: Le Quang Nhat/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
item.media:description: Anti-China demonstrators shouted slogans during a rally in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, on Sunday.

item.title: Letter From India: For Indians, Much Depends on Family Background
item.description: For all India’s modernity and rising economic growth, the influence of inheritance, even if only in basic schooling and nourishment, still plagues the country.
item.dc:creator: By MANU JOSEPH
item.media:description: Indians lined up to vote in the eastern city of Kolkata on Monday.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Unable to Afford Surgery, Farmer Amputates His Own Feet
item.description: The Anhui man is the second farmer in less than a year to perform self-amputation after failing to find help through China’s rural insurance program.
item.dc:creator: By AMY QIN

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: Hong Kong’s Rising Cry
item.description: Locals are protesting with increasing intensity against Beijing’s meddling in the 2017 election process.
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL DEGOLYER

item.title: Pistorius Ordered to Undergo Psychiatric Tests
item.description: Oscar Pistorius’s murder trial seems set to be further delayed as an assessment determines whether he was affected by mental illness when he shot his girlfriend.
item.dc:creator: By ALAN COWELL

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: New Bad Old Times for Guatemala?
item.description: The country’s hard-won progress is faltering; it could easily slip back into violence.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
item.dc:creator: By ANITA ISAACS

item.title: Contributing Op-Ed Writer: The Battle of the Okinawans
item.description: The tenacity of opponents to U.S. bases is a lesson for the Japanese government.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.dc:creator: By NORIHIRO KATO

item.title: Fresh Signs Point to Possible European Central Bank Stimulus Plan
item.description: An E.C.B. official argued on Wednesday that the central bank would not violate its mandate if it bought government bonds, reinforcing expectations of further action to counteract low inflation.
item.dc:creator: By JACK EWING

item.title: Pentagon Weighs Transfer of Chelsea Manning to Civilian Facility
item.description: Private Manning, serving a 35-year sentence for leaking classified documents, has requested treatment for hormone therapy for “gender dysphoria.”
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.dc:creator: By HELENE COOPER

item.title: Lebanese TV Executive Is Summoned to Hague Court
item.description: The vice chairwoman of Al Jadeed TV appeared before the Special Tribunal for Lebanon to answer charges of contempt of court and obstruction of justice.
item.dc:creator: By MARLISE SIMONS

item.title: Anger Grows in Vietnam Over Dispute With China
item.description: The dispute has unleashed some of the worst civil unrest in recent years in Vietnam and has prompted what appears to have been a news media blackout by the government.
item.dc:creator: By MIKE IVES and THOMAS FULLER

item.title: Health Care Workers Under Attack in Syria, Doctors Say
item.description: Physicians for Human Rights released a report on Wednesday that said Syrian government forces were responsible for 90 percent of the confirmed assaults on health care facilities.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By RICK GLADSTONE

item.title: Colin Pillinger, 70, Dies; Set Europe’s Eye on Space
item.description: Dr. Pillinger led a shoestring effort to put a European lander on Mars — a mission that failed to reach its destination, but succeeded in elevating the profile of space exploration in Europe.
item.dc:creator: By WILLIAM YARDLEY
item.media:credit: Stefan Rousseau/Press Association, via Asoociated Press
item.media:description: Colin Pillinger discussing the Beagle 2 mission to Mars on Dec. 27, 2003, two days after it was supposed to have landed.

item.title: Cleric Spars With Prosecutor at Terror Trial
item.description: Undeterred by intense cross-examination, Mostafa Kamel Mostafa tried to question the prosecutor and continued to deny all charges against him during his trial in Lower Manhattan.
item.dc:creator: By BENJAMIN WEISER

item.title: H. R. Giger, Swiss Artist, Dies at 74; His Vision Gave Life to ‘Alien’ Creature
item.description: Mr. Giger was fascinated with the fusion of the human form and the machine.
item.dc:creator: By DOUGLAS MARTIN
item.media:description: H. R. Giger in Chur, Switzerland, in 2007 with his paintings, which, he said “crazy” people loved.

item.title: World Briefing: Uruguay: Inmate Tapped Into U.S. Ambassador’s Phone
item.description: A prisoner in Uruguay tapped into the American ambassador’s cellphone and tried to commit fraud, the authorities said Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: Pakistan: Departing Travelers Must Get Polio Vaccine
item.description: As of June 1, Pakistan will require everyone leaving the country to get a polio vaccination, the Health Ministry said Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: Saudi Arabia: Iranian Defense Minister Is Invited
item.description: Saudi Arabia has invited Iran’s foreign minister to visit, Saudi officials said Tuesday, a move that would hint at the possibility of a thaw between two bitter rivals.
item.dc:creator: By REUTERS

item.title: World Briefing: The Hague: Court to Review British War Crime Inquiry
item.description: The prosecutor at the International Criminal Court said she had reopened a preliminary investigation into accusations that British officials were responsible for the abuse of Iraqi prisoners.
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
item.dc:creator: By STEPHEN CASTLE

item.title: World Briefing: Central African Republic: U.S. Sanctions for Former Leader
item.description: President Obama has imposed sanctions on the Central African Republic’s former president, François Bozizé, and four other men linked to violence and human rights abuses.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: By REUTERS

item.title: Groups Back Global Plan for Tracking Commercial Flights
item.description: The issue gained urgency after Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 disappeared in March with 239 people aboard.
item.dc:creator: By MATTHEW L. WALD

item.title: Migdal Journal: A Resort in Galilee Rises Where Jesus May Have Taught
item.description: Pope Francis is expected to bless the project that includes a spirituality center built near what is presumed to be an ancient synagogue and the hometown of Mary Magdalene.
item.dc:creator: By ISABEL KERSHNER
item.media:credit: Rina Castelnuovo for The New York Times
item.media:description: Remains of a synagogue from the first century were found at the site of a planned spiritual resort.

item.title: 26 Percent of World’s Adults Are Anti-Semitic, Survey Finds
item.description: The study by the Anti-Defamation League also found that nearly half of the world’s adults have never heard of the Holocaust.
item.dc:creator: By RICK GLADSTONE
